syllabus_content:
Course Meeting Times

Lectures: 4 sessions / week, 1 hour / session

Description

Accelerated Introductory Portuguese for Spanish Speakers covers the basics of Portuguese grammar and presents selected cultural aspects of the Lusophone world, with special emphasis on Brazil.

Designed as an intensive introductory course equivalent to Portuguese I and II, it is a Portuguese course for native speakers of Spanish or speakers of other languages who have a native-like command of Spanish. The course focuses on those aspects of the Portuguese language that have proved to be more difficult for Spanish speakers, such as pronunciation, vocabulary, idioms, and grammatical structures particular to Portuguese.

Our focus is on communication, but the four basic language skills (listening, speaking, reading, and writing) are practiced. At the end of the course, students will have mastered the core grammar of Portuguese, as well as basic vocabulary. They should also be able to engage in everyday conversation with native speakers and read simple texts, both fiction and non-fiction, with relative ease. The class is conducted in Brazilian Portuguese.

Academic Integrity

Academic integrity is defined by the Center of Academic Integrity as "a commitment, even in the face of adversity, to five fundamental values: honesty, trust, fairness, respect, and responsibility." If you haven't done so yet, please read the
MIT Academic Integrity Handbook
. Learning a foreign language is not something that typically occurs in isolation. Communication and practice are essential. Therefore, working with others is highly encouraged. However, there are cases in which collaboration is tantamount to cheating. There follow some examples of what is allowed and what is not in our class: having your pronunciation corrected by a native speaker before an oral presentation is perfectly acceptable. They won't utter the words for you in class. Using a spellchecker is valid if you are writing a text, but having a text edited by another person before submission is clearly a different matter. To a certain extent, the editor is the coauthor of the text. Likewise, the use of dictionaries is recommended, but no translation program may be used. In a few words, obtaining help from people or online resources is allowed as a way of enhancing your learning, but should be avoided altogether if as a result of it, the work submitted is not an accurate representation of the student's progress or capacity. If that's the case, it will be considered academic dishonesty. If you have doubts about what you can do in this class, consult with your instructor.

files.title: Questions about a retranqueta do polidor
files.content:
Com base no conto A retranqueta do polidor, de Fernando Verissimo, responda:
1-‐ Sobre o que fala o conto?

2-‐ Voce concorda com o autor que "a mentira e necessaria" para a vida em sociedade?

3-‐ No portugues formal, nao se deve usar o pronome complemento no inicio da frase. Indique um
exemplo em que o autor o usa, revelando a linguagem coloquial do texto.

4-‐ Encontre uma frase em que o autor usa o presente do subjuntivo.

5-‐ O que significam, no contexto, as seguintes expressoes:

-‐
No caso de o carro enguicar
-‐
ate onde eu sei
-‐
nao se meta
-‐
Pronto
-‐
A esta altura...
-‐
Ele esta arrasado

files.title: Questions about João e Maria
files.content:
Com base no conto Joao e Maria de Luis Fernando Verissimo, responda as seguintes perguntas:
1-‐ De que trata o conto?

2-‐ Os nomes Joao e Maria fazem referencia a uma historia infantil. Como se chama esta historia
em ingles?

3-‐ No conto, ha algumas palavras escritas com caracteristicas do portugues oral. Encontre alguma.

4-‐ O que significam, no contexto
-‐
Volta e meia o Joao...
-‐
... a Maria e o Ze cochichando...
-‐
cornos
-‐
As mulheres toparam.
-‐
... o buraco da fechadura...

5-‐ Encontre um exemplo de verbo no

-‐
preterito-‐mais-‐que-‐perfeito simples
-‐
preterito-‐mais-‐que-‐perfeito composto
-‐
condicional

6-‐ Joao queria causar o mesmo dano que ele pensava que Maria lhe havia causado. Como se
chama este sentimento/esta acao?

7-‐ Voce, ou alguem que voce conhece, ja passou por alguma situacao muito embaracosa?

files.title: Questions about Puxa-Puxa reading
files.content:
Com base na leitura do conto "Puxa-‐puxa", responda as perguntas seguintes:
O que significam os seguintes verbos/expressoes
-‐
Solucar ("solucou a moca")
-‐
Estar morrendo de saudade
-‐
... fora vetada pela familia"
-‐
... o ceu da boca
-‐
Contrafeitos, botaram as balas...
Que adjetivos voce usaria para descrever Nora? E a mae?
No Brasil, o que e um "puxa-‐puxa", que deu titulo ao conto?
O que indicam as palavras no aumentativo, no contexto: "brigao" e "trabalhao"?
Segundo a gramatica da lingua portuguesa, nao se deve comecar uma frase com um pronome obliquo
(me, te, se, nos, vos). Mas no Brasil, isso e muito comum na lingua falada. Encontre algum exemplo do
uso do pronome no inicio da frase no conto.
Explique a ultima frase: "E a familia compreendeu que Nora tinha finalmente esquecido Jorjao."
Voce costuma trazer/levar encomendas quando viaja?
